title: Site
description: Comprehensive site requirements for indoor agriculture operations including site mapping, traceability, risk assessment, food defense controls, exterior sanitation, storage practices, and contamination prevention

requirements.text: Is there a map that accurately shows all aspects of the operation, including water sources and fixtures used to deliver water used in the operation?
mandatoryStatements: Current and accurate site map exists for the indoor agriculture operation
Map shows all growing areas and operational zones
Map identifies all water sources (municipal, well, recycled, etc.)
Map shows all water fixtures and delivery points
Map includes key infrastructure and equipment locations
Map is updated when facility changes occur
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that site map is current and accurate, update within 30 days of any facility changes
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly review of site map for accuracy, immediate update when changes occur

requirements.text: Are growing areas adequately identified or coded to enable trace back and trace forward in the event of a recall?
mandatoryStatements: All growing areas are identified with unique codes or identifiers
Identification system enables trace back to specific growing locations
Identification system enables trace forward to finished product
Coding system links growing areas to harvest records
System supports rapid identification during recall scenarios
Growing area identifications are clearly visible and documented
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual mock recall to verify traceability system effectiveness, quarterly verification of growing area identification accuracy
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that growing areas are properly identified, immediate correction of missing or unclear identifications

requirements.text: Has a documented risk assessment been developed, covering potential hazards associated with the site location and growing process including the flow of materials and personnel?
mandatoryStatements: Documented risk assessment exists for the site and operations
Assessment covers site location-specific hazards
Assessment evaluates growing process hazards
Assessment analyzes flow of materials for contamination risks
Assessment analyzes flow of personnel for contamination risks
Risk assessment identifies biological, chemical, and physical hazards
Assessment is signed off by qualified personnel
Assessment is reviewed and updated at least annually or when changes occur
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review and update of risk assessment, verification when operational changes occur
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Quarterly review of identified risks and controls, ongoing monitoring of risk control effectiveness

requirements.text: Where the risk assessment identifies the need for control of any hazards, are these controls indicated in the assessment and implemented?
mandatoryStatements: Risk assessment identifies specific controls for each identified hazard
Control measures are clearly documented in the assessment
All identified controls are implemented in operations
Controls are effective at reducing or eliminating hazards
Implementation of controls is verified through monitoring
Records demonstrate ongoing implementation of controls
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that all identified controls are implemented and effective
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily or weekly monitoring of critical control implementation, immediate corrective action if controls not followed

requirements.text: Are the necessary food defense controls implemented in the operation?
mandatoryStatements: Food defense controls are identified based on facility vulnerability assessment
Access control measures are implemented for facility and growing areas
Visitor management procedures are in place
Critical areas are secured against unauthorized access
Employees are trained on food defense awareness
Procedures address response to suspicious activity or threats
Controls are monitored and verified for effectiveness
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual food defense vulnerability assessment, quarterly verification of security controls
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring of access controls, immediate response to security breaches

requirements.text: Is the exterior area immediately outside the facility, including roads, yards and parking areas, free of litter, weeds and standing water?
mandatoryStatements: Exterior areas immediately outside facility are maintained clean
Roads and parking areas are free of litter and debris
Weeds are controlled in exterior areas
Standing water is eliminated or controlled
Regular cleaning and maintenance schedule for exterior areas
Exterior conditions do not attract pests or create contamination risks
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of exterior areas for cleanliness and maintenance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily visual checks of exterior areas, immediate cleanup of litter or standing water

requirements.text: Is any packaging stored outside, being stored protected?
mandatoryStatements: If packaging is stored outside, it is adequately protected from contamination
Packaging is covered or enclosed to prevent exposure to weather
Storage method prevents pest access to packaging materials
Packaging is elevated off ground to prevent moisture damage
Storage location minimizes risk of contamination
Packaging is inspected before use if stored outside
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly verification of outdoor packaging storage conditions
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily checks of packaging storage protection, immediate correction if protection compromised

requirements.text: Are control measures being implemented for the outside storage of equipment, pallets, tires etc. (i.e., out of the mud, stacked to prevent pest harborage, away from the building perimeter)?
mandatoryStatements: Equipment and materials stored outside are kept out of mud and water
Items are stacked or stored to prevent pest harborage
Storage is located away from building perimeter to reduce pest access
Storage areas are organized and maintained clean
Items are elevated or placed on clean surfaces
Unused equipment and materials are properly stored or removed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of outdoor storage areas and practices
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of outdoor storage conditions, immediate correction of pest harborage conditions

requirements.text: Is the area around the dumpster/cull truck/trash area clean?
mandatoryStatements: Area around dumpsters and trash receptacles is kept clean
Spillage and overflow are promptly cleaned up
Area is free of litter and debris
Regular cleaning schedule for trash areas is maintained
Trash area does not attract pests or create odors
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly inspection of trash area cleanliness
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring of dumpster area, immediate cleanup of spills or overflow

requirements.text: Are outside garbage receptacles and dumpsters kept covered or closed?
mandatoryStatements: All outside garbage receptacles have covers or lids
Dumpsters are kept closed when not actively in use
Covers and lids are functional and in good repair
Practice of keeping containers covered is enforced
Covered containers prevent pest access and odor release
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly verification that dumpsters and receptacles are properly covered
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily checks that trash containers remain covered, immediate correction if found open

requirements.text: Where soil, substrates or fertilizer (e.g., compost) are stored or handled, are measures in place to ensure seepage and runoff is collected or diverted and does not reach growing areas, product, or any of the water sources? A ZERO POINT DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Soil, substrates, and fertilizer storage locations are identified and controlled
Containment measures prevent seepage from reaching growing areas
Containment measures prevent runoff from reaching product
Containment measures prevent contamination of water sources
Berms, barriers, or drainage systems are in place where needed
Storage areas are located away from sensitive areas
Regular inspection of containment measures for effectiveness
requirements.verificationExpectations: Weekly verification of containment measures, immediate action if seepage or runoff detected
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring of soil/substrate/fertilizer storage areas, especially after rain or irrigation

requirements.text: Where there are fill stations for fuel, pesticides, or liquid fertilizer, is it evident that the location and/or use is not a risk of contamination to the product, water sources, growing areas, equipment, packaging materials, etc.?
mandatoryStatements: Fill stations are located away from product, growing areas, and water sources
Physical separation or barriers prevent contamination
Secondary containment is provided for spill control
Fill station location and design minimize contamination risk
Procedures for safe filling operations are established
Spill response equipment and procedures are available
Regular inspection of fill stations for leaks or contamination
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification of fill station safety and contamination prevention
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of fill station condition, immediate response to spills or leaks

requirements.text: Has the operation eliminated or adequately controlled any potential sources of contamination (physical, chemical or biological) not covered by other more specific questions?
mandatoryStatements: All potential contamination sources are identified
Physical contamination sources are eliminated or controlled
Chemical contamination sources are eliminated or controlled
Biological contamination sources are eliminated or controlled
Controls are appropriate to the level of risk
Site-specific contamination risks are addressed
Regular review identifies new potential contamination sources
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly site inspection for contamination sources, annual risk assessment update
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of contamination controls, immediate action for new contamination risks

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of animal presence and/or animal activity (wild or domestic) in the audited area? If Total Conformance, go to 3.02.14
mandatoryStatements: No animals (wild or domestic) are present in growing areas
No animals are present in storage areas or facility interior
No evidence of animal activity (tracks, droppings, nesting, damage)
Animal exclusion measures are effective
Building integrity prevents animal entry
Regular inspection for animal presence and activity
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection for animal presence and activity during operations
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring for animal presence, immediate response if animals detected

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of evidence of animal fecal matter in the audited area? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWNSCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: No animal fecal matter is present in any audited areas
Growing areas are completely free of animal feces
Storage areas are free of animal feces
Immediate response procedures exist for fecal contamination
Product is protected from fecal contamination
Daily inspection confirms absence of fecal matter
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection for animal fecal matter before and during operations
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous vigilance for fecal contamination, immediate containment and cleanup if found

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of human fecal matter in the audited area? ANY DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: No human fecal matter is present anywhere in audited areas
Adequate restroom facilities prevent human waste contamination
Immediate response procedures exist for human waste incidents
Workers understand prohibition on open defecation
Facilities and policies prevent human fecal contamination
Daily inspection confirms absence of human fecal matter
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily inspection for any signs of human fecal contamination
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring, zero tolerance for human fecal matter, immediate facility shutdown if found

requirements.text: Is there no evidence of infants or toddlers in the audited area?
mandatoryStatements: Infants and toddlers are not present in growing areas
Infants and toddlers are not present in storage or production areas
Written policy prohibits infants and toddlers in audited areas
Policy is communicated to all workers
Alternative childcare arrangements are available if needed
Policy is enforced consistently
requirements.verificationExpectations: Daily verification that no infants or toddlers are in restricted areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Continuous monitoring for presence of infants/toddlers, immediate removal if found

capaInject: If site map inaccurate or missing: update map within 14 days, verify accuracy with facility walkthrough
If growing area identification inadequate: implement identification system within 30 days, conduct mock recall to verify
If risk assessment missing or inadequate: develop comprehensive assessment within 30 days, implement identified controls within 60 days
If identified hazard controls not implemented: immediate implementation of critical controls, complete all controls within 14 days
If seepage or runoff reaches growing areas or water sources: immediate containment, implement permanent controls within 7 days
If animal presence detected: immediate area clearance, enhance exclusion measures within 7 days, verify effectiveness
If animal fecal matter found: immediate product hold, area sanitization, investigation within 24 hours, enhanced monitoring
If human fecal matter found: immediate facility shutdown, comprehensive sanitization, full investigation, corrective actions before restart
If infants or toddlers found in restricted areas: immediate removal, policy reinforcement within 24 hours
traceabilityInject: Site map must show all areas relevant to product traceability
Growing area identification codes must be traceable to harvest records and finished product
Risk assessment must be traceable to identified hazards and implemented controls
Food defense activities must be documented and traceable
Any contamination incidents must be fully documented with traceability to affected product and areas
